childnodes.sy: You may go to Workshop in Clerkenwell for their excellent coffee, but will probably be enticed into also ordering something delicious to eat – like their yummy roasted tomato soup.
Caravan serves a very nice – and very strong -- latte in Exmouth Market and makes an excellent alternative to Starbucks for true coffee connoisseurs.
The Coffeeworks Project in Camden Passage makes the perfect lunch break stop, serving amazing coffees, baked treats like brownies and jam tarts, and delicious sandwiches, all in a great atmosphere.

When the hour is ungodly and you need a shot of caffeine straight to your brain, head to Monmouth Coffee Company. This place is well established and well known, so be prepared to wait a half an hour on the weekend or after 10am on a weekday.

Where better to get your coffee than in an old, converted, underground male lavatory? The Attendant is certainly one of the most unusual places to order a gingerbread latte and salted caramel brownie, but fear not – it’s classy and clean.
The deserving winner of London Coffee Shop of the Year in 2013, Benugo serves up wonderful coffee, tea, pastries and cakes in a fun atmosphere. What a delicious way to start the day.

Buzz yourself in to one of the newest, most intriguing coffee shops in town. Ziferblat is a Russian-style cafe where you can help yourself to their excellent coffee, tea, toast and biscuits -- just keep an eye on the clock because they charge by the

t: Perk Up at Top Coffee Spots
